>From: Yanshosh@...
>Reply-To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
>To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: AT LAST!
>Date: Thu, 19 Apr 2001 06:17:04 -0000
>
>YES! Allright, I have just completed the poll system in the login, and
>now its time to begin going full gear toward the election. For this,
>several things need to happen first:
>
>We need to get comfortable with the login system, and all get
>usernames on it. Several events will lead to this:
>
>1. All character profiles on the site will have to be DELETED. PLEASE
>go to the site and save them on your comps or print them out or
>something, unless you want to rewrite them, which is fine.
>
>2. When you're done backing up all your chars, send me an email with
>the following info:
>    a. Desired username (for the site).
>    b. A suggestion for the message board colors (two text colors and
>two background colors. Text and background should look nice together).
>
>3. When I get your email, I will make you an account on the site and
>send you the username and a temporary password for it.
>
>4. You should log in (there is now a link from the main page, which is
>at http://nbwrpg.com), and change your password, using the password
>changer once you're logged in. KEEP IN MIND: do NOT use the password
>from your email or any other service you have. I CAN and sometimes
>will have to view these passwords for site upkeep, so just make up new
>passwords. If you forget your password, email me and I'll send it to you.
>
>5. Submit all your chars and everything.
>
>After all that's done, we'll go on with the council election. This is
>what I figure it could be like:
>
>First everyone who wants to run for council emails me, and I make a
>list of everyone running. Then I post the list on here, and every
>person on that list needs to get two 'supporters' from amongst the
>RPGs. People running for council can support one person (not
>themselves), and people that arn't running can support two _different_
>people (they can also support themselves, though why they'd want to do
>this is beyond me). Once a person that is running for council has two
>supporters, those two supporters should email me or IM me or
>something. I'll keep track of everything. There'll be a set amount of
>time to get supporters, and if you can't get two, then you can't run.
>After that we'll have a vote at the site, and the new council will be
>elected. I think the council will have three people other than me, so
>we'll pick the people with the three highest vote results.
>
>Of course, everything in that last paragraph is just ideas by me and
>by some of the others and are still up for debate, but I think its a
>good plan. If anyone has ideas, email me.
>
>
>I'm sorry that I didn't RP much today. Programming takes alot of time
>and energy. I'm barely awake now, so I'm gonna go, but I'll post tomorrow.
>
>Go to the site and save your chars, everyone. Lets get this done as
>soon as possible.
>
>
>
>Zzzzzzzzzzzzzzz..........
>
